welcome.title: Welcome
welcome.subtitle: Votive Assessment
welcome.heading: Before You Design Who You Want to Become...
welcome.subheading: You need to understand who you already are.
welcome.description:
This assessment guides you through two foundational phases:

**Phase 1: State Awareness** — Understanding how you operate (your energy, mood, and motivation patterns)

**Phase 2: Identity Mapping** — Understanding who you currently are (your actual identity revealed through behavior)

Most people skip these steps and jump straight to goal-setting. That's why most goals fail. Identity change isn't about becoming someone else — it's about becoming more fully yourself.

This takes about 15-20 minutes of honest reflection. There are no right answers.

peakEnergy.question: When do you typically experience your highest energy and mental clarity?
peakEnergy.context: Select all that apply. Think about when you do your best thinking, not when you're forced to be productive.

lowEnergy.question: When do you typically experience your lowest energy or motivation?
lowEnergy.context: Select all that apply. Be honest — this isn't about weakness, it's about working with your natural rhythms.

energyConsistency.question: How consistent is your energy level from day to day?
energyConsistency.context: Think about a typical week, not exceptional circumstances.

energyDrains.question: What activities or situations drain your energy most quickly?
energyDrains.context: Consider both obvious drains (difficult meetings) and subtle ones (decision-making, context-switching).
energyDrains.placeholder: Examples: Back-to-back meetings, ambiguous tasks, social obligations, decision fatigue...

energyRestores.question: What reliably restores your energy?
energyRestores.context: Not what "should" restore it, but what actually does. Be specific.
energyRestores.placeholder: Examples: Solitary walks, completing a task, deep work sessions, specific people...

moodTriggers.question: What most commonly triggers a negative mood shift for you?
moodTriggers.context: Select your top 3-5. Understanding your triggers is the first step to managing them.

motivationReliability.question: How reliable is your motivation for important tasks?
motivationReliability.context: Be honest. This isn't a judgment — unreliable motivation is precisely why systems matter.
motivationReliability.highLabel: Very reliable — I do what I plan

willpowerPattern.question: When you fail to follow through on intentions, what's the most common pattern?
willpowerPattern.context: Select the one that happens most often.

neverStart.label: I never start
neverStart.description: The task feels too big or unclear

intro.heading: Phase 2: Identity Mapping
intro.subheading: Your identity is revealed through your behaviors, not your intentions.
intro.description:
Now we'll explore who you actually are — not who you wish you were or who you think you should be.

This phase examines:
• How you define yourself now
• What you consistently do (your actual habits)
• What's already working (keystone behaviors)
• Your core values and strengths

Remember: sustainable change builds upon who you are, not against it.

identityStatements.question: Complete this sentence 5-10 times: "I am someone who..."
identityStatements.context: Write statements that feel true based on your actual behavior. Not aspirations — evidence. What would someone conclude about you from watching your daily life?
identityStatements.placeholder:
I am someone who...
I am someone who...
I am someone who...
I am someone who...
I am someone who...

othersDescribe.question: How would people who know you well describe you?
othersDescribe.context: Think about what colleagues, friends, or family would say. What patterns do they notice that you might miss?
othersDescribe.placeholder: What do people come to you for? What do they expect from you? What surprises them when you don't do it?

automaticBehaviors.question: What do you do automatically, without thinking or deciding?
automaticBehaviors.context: These are your existing habits — both helpful and unhelpful. Morning routines, responses to stress, how you spend transition time, etc.
automaticBehaviors.placeholder:
Examples:
• Check phone first thing in morning
• Make coffee before anything else
• Open specific apps when bored
• Respond to messages immediately
• Plan tomorrow before sleep

keystoneBehaviors.question: Which of your current behaviors create the biggest positive ripple effects?
keystoneBehaviors.context: Keystone behaviors affect multiple areas of your life. When you do them, other things tend to go well. When you skip them, things start falling apart.
keystoneBehaviors.placeholder: Examples: Morning exercise, daily planning, consistent sleep schedule, weekly review...

coreValues.question: Select the values that feel most essential to who you are.
coreValues.context: Choose 5-7 maximum. Not what you think you should value — what actually drives your decisions and causes distress when violated.

naturalStrengths.question: What comes naturally to you that others seem to struggle with?
naturalStrengths.context: These are your leverage points. Sustainable identity evolution amplifies strengths rather than fighting weaknesses.
naturalStrengths.placeholder: Think about: What do people ask for your help with? What feels easy to you but hard for others?

resistancePatterns.question: What have you repeatedly tried to change about yourself but failed?
resistancePatterns.context: No judgment — this reveals where your current identity is strongly anchored. These areas need identity bridges, not willpower.
resistancePatterns.placeholder: Examples: Exercise consistency, morning routines, eating habits, procrastination patterns...

identityClarity.question: How clear is your sense of who you are?
identityClarity.context: This is about self-knowledge, not confidence.
identityClarity.lowLabel: Unclear — I feel like different people in different contexts
identityClarity.highLabel: Very clear — I have a stable sense of self

synthesis.title: Synthesis
synthesis.subtitle: Your Foundation
synthesis.heading: Your Identity Foundation
synthesis.description: A synthesis of your Phase 1 & Phase 2 insights. This becomes the basis for designing sustainable change.

resistancePatterns.title: Resistance Patterns
resistancePatterns.helpText: These areas need identity bridges, not willpower. Phase 3 will address how to design achievable stepping-stone identities.

whatsNext.title: What's Next?
whatsNext.description: You now have a map of your current operating system. Phase 3 (Identity Design) uses this foundation to design who you want to become — ensuring your aspirational identity is:

achievable.title: Achievable
achievable.description: a realistic progression from where you are

aligned.title: Aligned
aligned.description: building on your values and strengths

bridged.title: Bridged
bridged.description: with stepping-stone identities to make the path believable
